title: Starting Kernel on Windows10 Causes Errors and Loads Multiple (GUIs)
body:
#### Problem description

Thanks for the great work on this. I've used it on Mac, Windows, and Linux. All without bugs. Today I went to start a notebook with the Stata Kernel. The current setting worked fine last week. Here is a description of the behavior today:

1 . Launch Jupyter Notebook.
2. Open a new notebook with the Stata Kernel.
3. Immediately launching the Stata Kernel I get five GUI sessions of Stata in my start bar.
4. Below is the output from my Anaconda Prompt window.

It was a long while ago, but when I last successfully ran a Stata Kernel on a Windows computer I don't recall the GUI also launching (certainly not five times). Looks like maybe my configuration has a flaw which is bypassing the Windows Stata Automation which causes an error and then it tries again four more times.

#### Debugging log

My installation is not producing a log file at: `$HOME/.stata_kernel_cache/console_debug.log` which on this setup is `D:\Users\data_science_role\.stata_kernel_cache`.

_From my Anaconda Prompt window:_


#### Code Sample

Not applicable

#### Expected Output

Not applicable

#### Other information

If you didn't attach the debugging log, please provide:

- OS Name:	Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]
- Stata Version / Location: C:\Program Files (x86)\Stata15\StataSE-64.exe
- Package information:

```
Name: stata-kernel
Version: 1.6.2
Summary: A Jupyter kernel for Stata. Works with Windows, macOS, and Linux. Preserves program state.
Home-page: https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel
Author: Kyle Barron
Author-email: barronk@mit.edu
License: GPLv3
Location: d:\users\data_science_role\appdata\local\continuum\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
Requires: pygments, pandas, pexpect, jupyter-client, requests, ipykernel, beautifulsoup4, IPython, packaging, pillow, jupyt
er, pywin32
Required-by:
```
Also useful to know:

- Stata runs on its own fine.
- Python Kernel running fine.

#### Other steps taken

1. Ran `pip install stata_kernel --upgrade`
2. Restarted computer.
3. Restarted Jupyter Notebooks.
4. Started new notebook with Stata Kernel.
5. Error seems to be persisting.

After the above:

1. Started Jupyter Notebooks in Firefox instead of Chrome.
2. Error persists in Firefox.

After the above:

1. Uninstalled Stata
2. Installed Stata
3. Restarted computer
4. Ran `pip install stata_kernel --upgrade`
5. Started new notebook with Stata Kernel.
6. Error seems to be persisting.

#### Edit(s):

Oct 29 11am Eastern Time: Added explanatory text in italics under debug log.
